pr_title: Scoreboard can show more CTW teams and wools per team.

timeline.message:
Scoreboard: No blank lines if a CTW map has >5 teams

Signed-off-by: alexsosnovsky <60436249+alexsosnovsky@users.noreply.github.com>

Scoreboard: If a team has to capture >5 wools, only 1 space is inserted between each.

Signed-off-by: alexsosnovsky <60436249+alexsosnovsky@users.noreply.github.com>

Wools can fit on the team name's line on the scoreboard

Signed-off-by: alexsosnovsky <60436249+alexsosnovsky@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: Being wool or not, shouldn't be the reason used to compact, See the isCompactWool method, what it defines is that wools should be compacted if they don't fit the scoreboard.
timeline.author: Pablete1234

timeline.bodyText: Make the "isWool()" into a "isHighlyCompact()" or something along the lines, don't use "competitors with goals" as your reason, make it the total rows being > MAX_ROWS even using the normally compact format
timeline.author: Pablete1234

timeline.bodyText: Again, instead of basing this on amount of wools, base it off of if the characters will fit
timeline.author: Pablete1234
Pablete1234

timeline.bodyText:
I really do not think that this should be changed.
That not all teams & their wools will fit is a shame, but joining team name & objectives is a worse solution than the problem itself, i'd just accept that the last teams' wools (wich, because they should be sorted, should be the losing one) won't be visible in scoreboard and only visible in /match
timeline.author: Pablete1234

timeline.bodyText: See above comment for all of this inline functionality
timeline.author: Pablete1234

timeline.bodyText: Adding a space every other wool looks extremely weird in the scoreboard, do either one or none, but don't toggle
timeline.author: Pablete1234

timeline.bodyText: Inlining looks really weird, I don't agree that we should allow that.
timeline.author: Electroid

timeline.message:
Remove inline functionality for the time being.

You should use lambda here. Something like:
(Goal a, Goal b) -> a.getName().compareToIgnoreCase(b.getName());

Comparators.comparing(Goal::getName, String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER)
